duties_responsibilities.duty: Responsible for creating and maintaining summary schedules for manufacturing of finished materials by effectively balancing lead time and capacity.
Acts as primary information conduit between operations and commercial departments.
Perform schedule analysis such as critical path identification, schedule risk identification, and variance investigation.
Perform capacity monitoring and analysis to identify and resolve capacity constraints using proven industry best-practices such as level-loading, expediting, and outsourcing.
Proactively identifies and manages the resolution of critical schedule issues.
Lead resolution of urgent product manufacturing issues to support the master schedule.
Integrate, maintain and analyze primary data related to project backlog and history.
Compile and analyze Key Performance and Visual Management Indicators.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Operations, Supply Chain Management, Business, or similar; or equivalent work experience.
